newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toho to spend 22 bln yen to rebuild Tokyo theatre.
newsitem.headline: Toho to spend 22 bln yen to rebuild Tokyo theatre.

text.p: Japanese movie maker and theatre operator Toho Co Ltd said on Tuesday that it had decided to spend 22 billion yen to rebuild its flagship theatre in central Tokyo.
The company plans to close down the theatre, in the Yurakucho district of Tokyo, at the end of 1997, and start constructing a new building on the site in July 1998, it said in a statement.
The new 17-storey building will have a 2,000-seat concert hall as well as an 800-seat movie theatre. The new facilities are expected to open in January 2001.
Toho said the move would not affect the company's earnings forecast for the current fiscal year.
The company expects to post sales of 73.3 billion yen and parent current profit of 9.8 billion yen in its current business year to February 28, 1997.
